instruction.en: Press the include button on your Philio PAN08 three times
instruction.nl: Druk driemaal op de include knop op de Philio PAN08

hint.en: See the manual for explanation
hint.nl: See the manual for explanation

label.en: Interval (in 5sec) to report instant power consumption
label.nl: Interval (in 5sec) to report instant power consumption

label.en: Interval (in 10min) to report accumulated power consumption
label.nl: Interval (in 10min) to report accumulated power consumption

instruction.en:
1.  Put your Z-Wave controller into inclusion mode by following the instructions provided by the controller manufacturer. 
2.  Pressing On/Off button three times within 2 seconds will enter inclusion 
     mode on the switch.

hint.en: If  the  setting  is  configured  for  1hour  (set  value  =720),  the  PAN11  will  report  its instant power consumption every 1 hour to Group1 node.    The maximum interval to report its instant power consumption is 45 hours (5s*32767/3600=45hr).

If  the  setting  is  configured  for  1hour  (set  value  =6),  the  PAN11  will  report  its Accumulated  Power  Consumption  (KW/h)  every  1  hour  to  Group1  node.   The maximum interval to report its Accumulated Power Consumption (KW/h) is 227.55 days (10min*32767/1440=227.55 days).

label.en: Threshold of current for Load Caution

hint.en: This is a warning when the current of load over the preset threshold value, if the setting value is 3000, when the load current of Relay1 over this value, PAN11 will send current meter report to warn the Group1 node, the Range of the setting value is from 10 to 3000,and the default value is 3000.

label.en: Threshold of KWh for Load Caution

hint.en:
This is a warning when the KWh of load over the preset threshold value, If the 
setting value is 10000, when the Accumulated Power Consumption of Relay1 over this value, PAN11 will send KWH meter report to warn the Group1 node, 
minimum value is 1KWh and default value is 10000 kWh.
Whenever the AC power return from lost, PAN11 will restore the switch state which could be SWITCH OFF„ÄÅLAST SWITCH STATE„ÄÅSWITCH ON. The default setting is LAST SWITCH STATE.

When the mode of switch On/Off is set to 0, any command of switch off will be 
disabled  and  the  On/Off  function  of  include  button  will  be  disabled.  The  default setting is enable mode.

1. Show Switch StateÔºöWhen switch is on, LED is on. When switch is off, LED is off. The default setting is Show Switch State. 
 2. Show Night modeÔºöWhen switch is on, LED is off. When switch is off, LED is on. 
 3. One Flash modeÔºöWhen the state of switch changes, LED will be on only one second, then LED keeps off.

Whenever PAN11 switches to on, the auto off timer begin to count down. After the timer decrease to zero, it will switch to off automatically. However if Auto off timer is set as 0, the auto off function will be disabled. The default setting is 0.

Whenever  a  switch  off    command,  BASIC_SET „ÄÅ BINARY_SWITCH_SET „ÄÅ
SWITCH_ALL_OFF, is received, it could be interpreted as 4 variety of commands.   
1. Switch OffÔºöIt switches to OFF state. The default setting is Switch Off. 
2. IgnoreÔºöThe switch off command will be ignored. 
3. Switch ToggleÔºöIt switches to the inverse of current state. 
4. Switch OnÔºöIt switches to ON state.

settings.label: Manual Switch report mode
settings.hint: When the PAN16-1 is manually toggled, send BINARY_SWITCH_REPORT to the node in Group 1. Default: Enabled

instruction.en: Put the battery in the device or tripple click the tamper button on the backside of the device to put in in inclusion/exclusion modus.
instruction.nl: Stop de batterij in het apparaat of klik drie keer op de tamper knop op de achterzijde / binnenkant van het apparaat om deze in de toevoeg/verwijder modus te zetten.

hint.en: Setting the BASIC OFF command value to turn OFF the light. 255 = Turn On. 1 - 100 = Dimming level. 0 = Turn Off
Setting the BASIC ON command value to turn ON the light. 255 = Turn On. 1 - 100 = Dimming level. 0 = Turn Off

label.en: Temperature report enabled (Celcius), Flood sensor enabled
Temperature report enabled (Fahrenheit), Flood Sensor enabled
Temperature report enabled (Celcius), Flood sensor disabled
Temperature report enabled (Fahrenheit), Flood Sensor disabled

hint.en: Bit 0: Disable Flood. Bit 1 - 2: Reserved. Bit 3: Temperature, 0 = Fahrenheid; 1 = Celcius. Bit 4: Reserved. Bit 5: Temperature report after event, 1 = Disable; 0 = Enable. Bit 6 - 7: Reserved
Bit0 - Bit5: Reserved. Bit6: Disable the humidity report after event triggered. (1:Disable, 0:Enable)

Bit 0 - Bit2: Reserved. Bit3: Disable send out BASIC OFF after the flood event cleared. Bit 4: Notification Type (0 = Using notification report, 1 = Using binary report). Bit 5: Multi CC in auto report (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable), Bit 6: Report battery state when device triggered (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable). Preferred settings for Homey: 16.

The interval time for auto reporting the battery level. 0 = Turn off auto report battery. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for auto reporting the temperature state. 0 = Turn off auto report temperature. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The Interval time for auto reporting the Humidity state. 0 = Turn off auto report illumination. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The Interval time for auto reporting the Flood state. 0 = Turn off auto report illumination. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for each auto report tick. Setting this configuration will effect configurations Auto Report Battery Time, Door/Window State Time, Illumination Time and Tempperature Time. 0 = Turn off all auto report functions. 1-255 = Interval time in minutes. Default is 30.

0 = Turn of this function. Enable this function the device will measure every minute. When the temperature is over 140 degrees Fahrenheit, it will continue report. This setting is in Fahrenheit even if you set the reporting to Celsius
The humidity differential to report. The unit is percentage. When enabled, the device will detect every 10 seconds.

How many seconds will the tamper alarm be activated.
Range: 0 (don't cancel), 1 - 86400 seconds
hint.nl:
Hoeveel seconden moet het tamper alarm geactiveerd blijven.
Bereik: 0 (niet annuleren), 1 - 86400 seconden

instruction.en: Put the battery in the device or tripple click the tamper button on the backside of the device to put in in inclusion/exclusion modus.
instruction.nl: Stop de batterij in het apparaat of klik drie keer op de tamper knop op de achterzijde / binnenkant van het apparaat om deze in de toevoeg/verwijder modus te zetten.

hint.en: Bit 0: Reserved. Bit 1: Reserved. Bit 3: Temperature, 0 = Fahrenheid; 1 = Celcius. Bit 4: Reserved. Bit 5: Temperature report after event, 1 = Disable; 0 = Enable. Bit 6: Reserved. Bit 7: Reserved

Bit 0 - 3: Reserved. Bit 4: Notification Type (0 = Using notification report, 1 = Using binary report). Bit 5: Multi CC in auto report (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable), Bit 6: Report battery state when device triggered (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable). Preferred settings for Homey: 00000110 = 48.

The interval time for auto reporting the battery level. 0 = Turn off auto report battery. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for auto reporting the temperature state. 0 = Turn off auto report temperature. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The Interval time for auto reporting the Humidity state. 0 = Turn off auto report illumination. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for each auto report tick. Setting this configuration will effect configurations Auto Report Battery Time, Door/Window State Time, Illumination Time and Tempperature Time. 0 = Turn off all auto report functions. 1-255 = Interval time in minutes. Default is 30.

0 = Turn of this function. Enable this function the device will measure every minute. When the temperature is over 140 degrees Fahrenheit, it will continue report. This setting is in Fahrenheit even if you set the reporting to Celsius
The humidity differential to report. The unit is percentage. When enabled, the device will detect every 10 seconds.

How many seconds will the tamper alarm be activated.
Range: 0 (don't cancel), 1 - 86400 seconds
hint.nl:
Hoeveel seconden moet het tamper alarm geactiveerd blijven.
Bereik: 0 (niet annuleren), 1 - 86400 seconden

instruction.en: Put the battery in the device or tripple click the tamper button on the backside of the device to put in in inclusion/exclusion modus.

hint.en: Setting the BASIC OFF command value to turn OFF the light. 255 = Turn On. 1 - 100 = Dimming level. 0 = Turn Off
Setting the BASIC ON command value to turn ON the light. 255 = Turn On. 1 - 100 = Dimming level. 0 = Turn Off
Bit 0: Disable Flood. Bit 1 - 7: Reserved. Preferred settings for Homey: 00000000 = 0.

Bit 0 - Bit2: Reserved. Bit3: Disable send out BASIC OFF after the flood event cleared. Bit 4: Notification Type (0 = Using notification report, 1 = Using binary report). Bit 5: Multi CC in auto report (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable), Bit 6: Report battery state when device triggered (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable). Preferred settings for Homey: 00001000 = 16.

The interval time for auto reporting the battery level. 0 = Turn off auto report battery. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The Interval time for auto reporting the Flood state. 0 = Turn off auto report illumination. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for each auto report tick. Setting this configuration will effect configurations Auto Report Battery Time, Door/Window State Time, Illumination Time and Tempperature Time. 0 = Turn off all auto report functions. 1-255 = Interval time in minutes. Default is 30.

How many seconds will the tamper alarm be activated.
Range: 0 (don't cancel), 1 - 86400 seconds
hint.nl:
Hoeveel seconden moet het tamper alarm geactiveerd blijven.
Bereik: 0 (niet annuleren), 1 - 86400 seconden

instruction.en: Press the tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the inclusion mode.
instruction.nl: Druk de programmeer/netwerk knop 3 keer in binnen 1.5 seconden.
instruction.de: Dr√ºcke den Taster auf der R√ºckseite der Alarmsirene 3x innerhalb von 1,5 Sekunden, um das Ger√§t in den Modus Automatische Anmeldung zu versetzen.

instruction.en: Press the tamper key three times within 1.5 seconds to enter the exclusion mode.
instruction.nl: Druk de programmeer/netwerk knop 3 keer in binnen 1.5 seconden.
instruction.de: Dr√ºcke den Taster auf der R√ºckseite der Alarmsirene 3x innerhalb von 1,5 Sekunden, um das Ger√§t in den Modus Entfernen zu versetzen.

hint.en: If the alarm is deactivated, it cannot be triggered.
hint.nl: Als het alarm is gedeactiveerd, kan het niet worden geactiveerd.
hint.de: Wenn der Alarm deaktiviert wird, kann dieser nicht ausgel√∂st werden.

hint.en: 1 = 30 seconds. 0 means never auto stop. Default value is 180 seconds (180 / 30 = 6).
hint.nl: 1 = 30 seconden. 0 betekend niet automatisch stoppen. De standaard waarde is 180 seconden (180 / 30 = 6).
hint.de: 1 = 30 Sekunden. 0 bedeutet, dass nie automatisch gestoppt wird. Der Standardwert ist 180 Sekunden (180 / 30 = 6).

instruction.en: Triple click the Tamper Switch on the backside confirms inclusion and exclusion.

hint.en: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light. 255 = Turn On. 1 - 100 = Dimming level
Parameter to set sensitivity of the PIR (Passiv Infrared Sensor). 0 = Disable PIR motion. 1 - 99 = 1 means the lowest sensitivity, 99 means the highest sensitivity

Setting the illumination threshold to turn on the light. When the event triggered and the environment illumination lower then the threshold, the device will turn on the light. 1 - 99 = 1 means darkest, 99 means brightest. 100 = Turn off illumination detected. 0 means turn off illumination detected function And never turn on the light.

Bit0. 0 - Home Automation mode 1 - Security Mode,Bit1. Test Mode,Bit2. Disable Door/Window Sensor,Bit3. 0 - Temperature in Fahrenheit; 1 - Temperature in Celsius,Bit4. Disable illumination report after event triggered,Bit5. Disable temperature report after event triggered, Bit6&7 = 0

Bit0. Disable magnetic integrate illumination,Bit1. Disable PIR integrate Illumination,Bit2. Disable magnetic integrate PIR,Bit3. When Bit2 is 0 (Enable), the device is install in the same room with the light? 0: In the same room(Default), 1: In the different room,Bit4. Disable delay 5 seconds to turn off the light, when door/window closed,Bit5. Disable auto turn off the light, after door/window opened to turn on the light. If Bit2 = 0, this setting is useless,Bit6. Enable temperature monitoring. When this bit enable, the temperature changed 3 degree Fahrenheit, it will report. And also the temperature over 140 degree Fahrenheit, it will report every 64 second
In the security mode, after the PIR motion detected, setting the re-detect time. 8 seconds per tick, and minimum time is 24 seconds, default tick is 3 (24 seconds)
After turn on the light, setting the delay time to turn off the light when the PIR motion is not detected. 8 seconds per tick, and minimum time is 32 seconds, default tick is 4 (32 seconds)
Interval time for auto report the battery level. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)
Interval time for auto report the door/window state. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)
Interval time for auto report the temperature. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)
Interval time for auto report the temperature. 30 minutes per tick and minimum time is 30 minutes, default tick is 12 (6 hours)

How many seconds will the tamper alarm be activated.
Range: 0 (don't cancel), 1 - 86400 seconds
hint.nl:
Hoeveel seconden moet het tamper alarm geactiveerd blijven.
Bereik: 0 (niet annuleren), 1 - 86400 seconden

instruction.en: Press the button on the inside once.
instruction.nl: Druk 1 keer op de knop aan de binnenkant.

hint.en: This is the controller group, it is not recommended to change this.
hint.nl: Dit is de controller groep, het is niet aangeraden deze te wijzigen.

hint.en: Devices associated here will receive the value in the setting "Group 2 Value" when motion is triggered.
hint.nl: Apparaten die hier zijn geassocieerd, krijgen de waarde in de setting "Groep 2 Waarde" wanneer het bewegingsalarm wordt geactiveerd.

hint.en:
The lower the value, the more motion is needed for the motion alarm to activate.
Range: 0 (motion off), 1 - 99
hint.nl:
Hoe lager de waarde, hoe meer beweging er nodig is om het bewegingsalarm te activeren.
Bereik: 0 (beweging uit), 1 - 99

hint.en:
After how many seconds of no motion will the motion alarm be de-activated.
Range: 0 (don't cancel), 1 - 86400 seconds
hint.nl:
Na hoeveel seconden moet het bewegingsalarm deactiveren bij geen beweging.
Bereik: 0 (niet annuleren), 1 - 86400 seconden

hint.en:
The time the motion alarm will be on unable to re-trigger or be extended until the alarm is canceled (in steps of 8 seconds).
Range: 8 - 1016 seconds
hint.nl:
De tijd het bewegingsalarm aan zal zijn zonder te kunnen her-activeren of verlengen tot het alarm is geannuleerd (in stappen van 8 seconden).
Bereik: 8 - 1016 seconden

hint.en:
How many seconds will the tamper alarm be activated.
Range: 0 (don't cancel), 1 - 86400 seconds
hint.nl:
Hoeveel seconden moet het tamper alarm geactiveerd blijven.
Bereik: 0 (niet annuleren), 1 - 86400 seconden

hint.en:
This value will be send to association group 2 when motion is detected.
Range: 0 (off command), 1 - 99 (1-100%), 255 (on command/previous state)
hint.nl:
Deze waarde word verzonden naar associatie groep 2 wanneer beweging is gedetecteerd.
Bereik: 0 (uit commando), 1 - 99 (1-100%), 255 (aan commando/vorige status)

hint.en:
After how many seconds will there be send an off command to association group 2, in steps of 8 seconds.
Range: 0 (Not Send), 8 - 1016 seconds
hint.nl:
Na hoeveel seconden zal er een uit commando worden verzonden naar associatie groep 2, in stappen van 8 seconden.
Bereik: 0 (Niet Verzonden), 8 - 1016 seconds

hint.en:
The interval the battery level will be send automatically.
Range: 0 (not send), 1 - 127
hint.nl:
De interval het batterij niveau automatisch verzonden word.
Bereik: 0 (niet verzonden), 1 - 127

hint.en: Choose which range will be used in the "battery level interval" setting.
hint.nl: Kies welk bereik er in de setting "batterij niveau interval" wordt gebruikt

instruction.en: Turn the knob to Area A (Bottom) and press the button 3 times.
instruction.nl: Draai de knop naar Zone A (Onder) en druk 3 keer op de knop.

hint.en: Battery level and current dim level get reported in here.
hint.nl: Batterij niveau en huidig dim niveau worden hier op gemeld.

hint.en: Dim level changes will be reported here.
hint.nl: Dim niveau veranderingen worden hier op gemeld.

hint.en: What dimming level will be send, when sending the 'Off' Command. Range: 0 - 99
hint.nl: Welk dim niveau moet worden verzonden bij het 'Uit' Commando. Bereik: 0 - 99

hint.en: What dimming level will be send, when sending the 'On' Command. Range: 1 - 99
hint.nl: Welk dim niveau moet worden verzonden bij het 'Aan' Commando. Bereik: 1 - 99

hint.en: Interval (in hours) for when to send the battery level. Range: 0 (off), 1 - 127
hint.nl: Interval (in uur) wanneer het batterij niveau word verzonden. Bereik: 0 (uit), 1 - 127

hint.en: Determine when the signal will be send.
hint.nl: Bepaal wanneer het signaal word verzonden.

label.nl: Met het drukken op de knop

hint.en: Determine if the buzzer will activate with the timer.
hint.nl: Bepaal of de buzzer activeert met de timer.

instruction.en: Turn the knob to Area A (Bottom) and press the button 3 times.
instruction.nl: Draai de knop naar Zone A (Onderin) en druk 3 keer op de knop.

hint.en: Battery level and current dim level get reported in here.
hint.nl: Batterij niveau en huidig dim niveau worden hier op gemeld.

hint.en: Dim level changes will be reported here.
hint.nl: Dim niveau veranderingen worden hier op gemeld.

hint.en: What dimming level will be send, when sending the 'Off' Command. Range: 0 - 99
hint.nl: Welk dim niveau moet worden verzonden bij het 'Uit' Commando. Bereik: 0 - 99

hint.en: What dimming level will be send, when sending the 'On' Command. Range: 1 - 99
hint.nl: Welk dim niveau moet worden verzonden bij het 'Aan' Commando. Bereik: 1 - 99

hint.en: Interval (in hours) for when to send the battery level. Range: 0 (off), 1 - 127
hint.nl: Interval (in uur) wanneer het batterij niveau word verzonden. Bereik: 0 (uit), 1 - 127

hint.en: Determine when the signal will be send.
hint.nl: Bepaal wanneer het signaal word verzonden.

label.nl: Met het drukken op de knop

instruction.en: Put the battery in the device or tripple click the tamper button on the backside of the device to put in in inclusion/exclusion modus.
instruction.nl: Stop de batterij in het apparaat of klik drie keer op de tamper knop op de achterzijde / binnenkant van het apparaat om deze in de toevoeg/verwijder modus te zetten.

hint.en: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light. 0 = Turn off the light, 1 - 100 = For dimmers 1 to 100 means the light strength, 255 = turns on the light. (Default)
Parameter to set the sensitivity for the PIR (Passiv Infrared Sensor). 0 = Disable PIR motion. 1 - 99 = 1 means the lowest sensitivity, 99 means the highest sensitivity

Setting the illumination threshold to turn on the light. When the event triggers and the environment illumination is lower than the threshold, the device will turn on the light. 0 = Turn off illumination detected function and never turn on the light.

label.en: Celcius, Door/Window-, Illumination- and Temperature report enabled
Fahrenheit, Door/Window-, Illumination- and Temperature report enabled
Celcius, Door/Window-, illumination and Temperature report disabled
Fahrenheit, Door/Window-, Illumination- and Temperature report disabled
Door/window disabled, Celsius, Door/Window-, Illumination- and Temp report enabled

hint.en: Bit 0: Reserved. Bit 1: Test mode, 1 = enable; 0 = normal mode. (Notice: this bit is ignored if DIP Switch is not set to Customer Mode). Bit 2: Door/window function, 1 = Disable; 0 = Enable. Bit 3: Temperature, 0 = Fahrenheid; 1 = Celcius. Bit 4: Illumination report after event, 1 = Disable; 0 = Enable. Temperature report after event, 1 = Disable; 0 = Enable.
Bit 0: Disable magnetic integrate illumination to turn on the lighting nodes in the association group 2. 1: Disable, 0: Enable, Bit 1: Disable PIR integrate Illumination to turn on the

Bit 0: Reserved. Bit 1: Sending motion OFF report (1 = Enable, 0 = Disable). Bit 2: PIR super sensitive mode (1 = Enable, 0 = Disable). Bit 3: Send out BASIC OFF after door closed (1 = Disabled, 0 = Enabled). Bit 4: Notification Type (0 = Using notification report, 1 = Using binary report). Bit 5: Multi CC in auto report (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable), Bit 6: Report battery state when device triggered (1 = Disable, 0 = Enable). Preferred settings for Homey: 00110110 = 54.

In the normal mode, after the PIR motion detected, setting the re-detect time. 8 seconds per tick, default is 3 (24 seconds). 1 - 127 = Number of ticks. 8 seconds per tick, default value is 3 (24 seconds).
After turn on the light, setting the delay time to turn off the light when the PIR motion is not detected. 8 seconds per tick, and minimum time is 32 seconds, default tick is 4 (32 seconds)

The interval time for auto reporting the battery level. 0 = Turn off auto report battery. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for auto reporting the door/window state. 0 = Turn off auto report door/window state. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The Interval time for auto reporting the illumination state. 0 = Turn off auto report illumination. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for auto reporting the temperature state. 0 = Turn off auto report temperature. 1-127 = Number of ticks. The default value is 12. The tick time can be set by configuration 'Auto Report Tick Interval'.

The interval time for each auto report tick. Setting this configuration will effect configurations Auto Report Battery Time, Door/Window State Time, Illumination Time and Tempperature Time. 0 = Turn off all auto report functions. 1-255 = Interval time for each tick (tick is 8 seconds). Default is 30.

0 = Turn of this function. Enable this function the device will measure every minute. When the temperature is over 140 degrees Fahrenheit, it will continue report. Enable this function will cause some issue, please check the 'Illumination Report' section of the manual.

The illumination differential to report. The unit is percentage. When enabled, the device will measure every minute. Enabling this functionality will cause some issue. Please check the 'Illumination Report' section of the manual.

How many seconds will the tamper alarm be activated.
Range: 0 (don't cancel), 1 - 86400 seconds
hint.nl:
Hoeveel seconden moet het tamper alarm geactiveerd blijven.
Bereik: 0 (niet annuleren), 1 - 86400 seconden

instruction.en: Put the battery in the device or tripple click the tamper button on the backside of the device to put in in inclusion/exclusion modus.
instruction.nl: Stop de batterij in het apparaat of klik drie keer op de tamper knop op de achterzijde / binnenkant van het apparaat om deze in de toevoeg/verwijder modus te zetten.

hint.en: Setting the BASIC command value to turn on the light. 0 = Turn off the light, 1 - 100 = For dimmers 1 to 100 means the light strength, 255 = turns on the light. (Default)
Parameter to set the sensitivity for the PIR (Passiv Infrared Sensor). 0 = Disable PIR motion. 1 - 99 = 1 means the lowest sensitivity, 99 means the highest sensitivity

Setting the illumination threshold to turn on the light. When the event triggers and the environment illumination is lower than the threshold, the device will turn on the light. 0 = Turn off illumination detected function and never turn on the light.

label.en: Celcius, Illumination- and Temperature report enabled
Fahrenheit, Illumination- and Temperature report enabled
Celcius, illumination and Temperature report disabled
Fahrenheit, Illumination- and Temperature report disabled
